definition: thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder

sentences.english: Stop, breathe for a sec, then sprint again.
sentences.chinese: 停下來，呼吸幾秒，然後再衝刺。

sentences.english: The runner kept some energy in store for spurting at the end.
sentences.chinese: 那名賽跑的人爲最後的衝刺貯存精力。

sentences.english: We sought to parry the charateristic soviet lunge with fancy footwork.
sentences.chinese: 我們以花式步法力圖避開典型的蘇聯衝刺。

sentences.english: Lynx have longer legs and much broader paws. This helps them charge around in snow.
sentences.chinese: 山貓腿較長，腳掌較寬，協助它們在雪地中衝刺。

sentences.english: The peak phase is characterized by short, fast workouts that simulate racing.
sentences.chinese: 衝刺階段的特徵是短而快的訓練，這是爲了模擬比賽。

sentences.english: Collecting my energy for one last push, I was eating a chocolate bar when along pedalled two 15-year-olds.
sentences.chinese: 爲了積蓄能量做最後衝刺，我吃了一塊巧克力。

sentences.english: This list of tasks becomes the Sprint Backlog.
sentences.chinese: 任務的列表就成了所謂的代辦衝刺。

sentences.english: The runner seemed to be rallying for a final sprint.
sentences.chinese: 賽跑者似乎在振作精神作最後衝刺。

sentences.english: The odor of disinfectant stung my nostrils as I moved down the row of pens.
sentences.chinese: 下樓梯時消毒水的味道衝刺着我的鼻孔。

sentences.english: Try it: go outside and sprint all-out for two minutes.
sentences.chinese: 試試吧，走到外面，竭盡全力地衝刺兩分鐘。

sentences.english: He sprinted past the other runners just before reaching the tape.
sentences.chinese: 他在到達終點之前全速衝刺，超越了其他賽跑者。

sentences.english: Sprints shall be run according to the rules governing sprint races.
sentences.chinese: 運動員的衝刺，以爭先賽的有關規則爲準。

sentences.english: I got the book-writing done by breaking it down into hour-long sprints.
sentences.chinese: 而這本書的完成我是以每小時爲單位做寫作衝刺的。

sentences.english: The product owner and team agree on a goal for the sprint.
sentences.chinese: 產品所有者和團隊會就衝刺階段的目標達成一致意見。

sentences.english: Hurdling is something that involves my whole body being stretched and contorted in quick bursts.
sentences.chinese: 跨欄賽跑需要在快速的衝刺中拉伸和扭曲整個身體。

sentences.english: Better to light one candle than to curse the darkness.
sentences.chinese: 與其詛咒妝呆妝婪，哄騙衝刺蠟燭。

definition: to pursue/to chase after/to accelerate/to catch up with/to overtake
despite/although/even though/in spite of/unhesitatingly/do not hesitate (to ask, complain etc)/(go ahead and do it) without hesitating
to relax/to relax efforts/to slack off/to take it easy/complacent/undisciplined
to warm up (sports)/(fig.) to prepare/to get in condition
(lit. and fig.) to carry a heavy load/to carry a heavy burden
to weigh one's abilities and act accordingly/to act according to one's means/to cut one's coat according to one's cloth
business in which a company has traditionally engaged (e.g. before diversifying)/original business/core business/(literary) agriculture
